com.apriori.concurrent

Class ThreadFactories

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.ThreadFactories

  • public final class ThreadFactories
extends Object
    Utility methods for creating thread factories.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • newGroupingThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingThreadFactory(ThreadGroup threadGroup)
        Returns a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and named after the given group. Thread names are in the format "threadgroupname-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.
        Parameters:
        threadGroup - the group to which created threads belong
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and named after the given group

      • newGroupingThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingThreadFactory(ThreadGroup threadGroup,
                                                     String threadNamePrefix)
        Returns a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and with the given name prefix. Thread names are in the format "prefix-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.
        Parameters:
        threadGroup - the group to which created threads belong
        threadNamePrefix - the prefix used to create thread names
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and wit the given name prefix

      • newGroupingThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingThreadFactory(String threadGroupName)
        Returns a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and with the given name prefix. Thread names are in the format "prefix-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.

        A new thread group is created with the given name.

        Parameters:
        threadGroupName - the name of the new group to which created threads belong
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and wit the given name prefix

      • newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory(ThreadGroup threadGroup)
        Returns a thread factory that creates daemon threads belonging to the given group and named after the given group. Thread names are in the format "threadgroupname-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.
        Parameters:
        threadGroup - the group to which created threads belong
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and named after the given group

      • newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory(ThreadGroup threadGroup,
                                                           String threadNamePrefix)
        Returns a thread factory that creates daemon threads belonging to the given group and with the given name prefix. Thread names are in the format "prefix-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.
        Parameters:
        threadGroup - the group to which created threads belong
        threadNamePrefix - the prefix used to create thread names
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and wit the given name prefix

      • newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory

        public static ThreadFactory newGroupingDaemonThreadFactory(String threadGroupName)
        Returns a thread factory that creates daemon threads belonging to the given group and with the given name prefix. Thread names are in the format "prefix-1". The suffix ("-1" in the example) contains a unique identifier so that each thread has a distinct name. The identifier starts at 1 for the first thread created, 2 for the second thread, and so on.

        A new thread group is created with the given name.

        Parameters:
        threadGroupName - the name of the new group to which created threads belong
        Returns:
        a thread factory that creates threads belonging to the given group and wit the given name prefix
